dt: {bc}set apart or separated from others of the same kind or group
{bc}divided in facilities or administered separately for members of different groups or races
{bc}restricted to members of one group or one race by a policy of {a_link|segregation}
{bc}practicing or maintaining segregation especially of races

shortdef: set apart or separated from others of the same kind or group
divided in facilities or administered separately for members of different groups or races
restricted to members of one group or one race by a policy of segregation

dt: {bc}to separate or set apart from others or from the general mass {bc}{sx|isolate||}
{bc}to cause or force the separation of (as from the rest of society)
{bc}to practice or enforce a policy of {a_link|segregation}

et: Latin {it}segregatus{/it}, past participle of {it}segregare{/it}, from {it}se-{/it} apart + {it}greg-, grex{/it} herd {ma}{mat|secede|}{/ma}
shortdef: to separate or set apart from others or from the general mass : isolate
to cause or force the separation of (as from the rest of society)
